text: using weave.jl, I am using `![…](…)` to insert an animated `.gif` to html and notebook outputs. Is there a way to skip this input for pdf output?

elements.text: to html and notebook outputs. Is there a way to skip this input for pdf output?

text: I'm guessing that you still need other images to show, so updating Weave's <http://weavejl.mpastell.com/dev/publish/#Templates|latex template> to overwrite <https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/252992/why-does-renewcommand-not-overwrite-includegraphics-from-tikzscale|includegraphics> wouldn't be a solution? More broadly, I think your question relates to something on my own wishlist, which is to use different plotting libraries for different weave outputs (ie plotlyjs / vega-lite for html, and pgfplots for pdf).

attachments.title: Why does \renewcommand not overwrite \includegraphics from tikzscale?
